Look, the main reason I asked to hold firing your new weapon was 
because I was not certain of wether it was in the bounds of legality 
or not. The way I saw it was that the weapon could send a bot to 
stasis lock in no time. We'd like to keep this rpg as fair to everyone 
as possible. That's all and there's no reason to say we don't like new 
ideas just because of that.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "x_rauq_x" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
> > Cardhead, When Azure suggested you hold your posting, you should 
> > hold your posting. He's not a moderator just so he can stand 
around 
> > and look pretty. Moderators are to be listened too, that way 
> > mistakes or misconceptions can be picked up and fixed before 
> > anything disasterous happens (we hope anyway). =)
> 
> Whoah, way to point your finger in the wrong direction.  The only 
> posts I made that had anything to do with the battle in the last 
> couple of days were to clarify the weapon's function.  It's not like 
> I kept shooting!  Jeez, just because you're a mod doesn't mean you 
> automatically know everything about a weapon someone else designed.
> 
> I'm not here to stand around and look pretty either.  If anyone 
needs 
> an attitude change, it's the people who expect the new guy to not 
> know shit about how RPGs work.  I've had a ton of writing and 
> roleplaying experience, thank you very much, and I know what I'm 
> doing.
> 
> You ought to be a little more prepared for those who show up with a 
> slew of ideas ready beforehand.  I'm not saying all my ideas should 
> go through, I'm saying I have them ready for when there's an 
opening.
